017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles;
020import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.Lookup;
021import java.lang.invoke.VarHandle;
022
023import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
024import java.lang.reflect.Executable;
025import java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType;
026import java.lang.reflect.GenericDeclaration;
027import java.lang.reflect.Method;
028import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
029import java.lang.reflect.Type;
030import java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable;
031import java.lang.reflect.WildcardType;
032
033import java.util.ArrayList;
034import java.util.Collection;
035import java.util.Collections;
036import java.util.Iterator;
037import java.util.List;
038import java.util.Map;
039import java.util.Objects;

041import java.util.function.Function;

043import org.microbean.development.annotation.Experimental;
044
045/**
046 * A {@link org.microbean.type.Type} that models a {@link
047 * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type} for use primarily by
048 * a {@link org.microbean.type.Type.Semantics} instance.
049 *
050 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
051 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
052 *
053 * @see org.microbean.type.Type.Semantics
054 */
055@Experimental
056public class JavaType extends org.microbean.type.Type<Type> {
057
058
059  /*
060   * Instance fields.
061   */
062
063
064  private final boolean box;
065
066
067  /*
068   * Constructors.
069   */
070
071
072  /**
073   * Creates a new {@link JavaType}.
074   *
075   * @param type the Java {@link Type} being modeled; must not be {@code null}
076   *
077   * @param box whether boxing of primitive types will be in effect;
078   * even if {@code true} boxing only happens to primitive types
079   *
080   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
081   */
082  protected JavaType(final Type type, final boolean box) {
083    super(box ? JavaTypes.box(type) : type);
084    this.box = box;
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Creates a new {@link JavaType} that models custom supertypes.
089   *
090   * <p>Among other things, this means that the {@link #object()}
091   * method will return {@code null}.</p>
092   *
093   * @param supertypes a {@link List} of supertypes; must not be
094   * {@code null}
095   *
096   * @param box whether boxing of primitive types will be in effect;
097   * even if {@code true} boxing only happens to primitive types
098   *
099   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supertypes} is {@code
100   * null}
101   */
102  protected JavaType(final List<?> supertypes, final boolean box) {
103    super(map(supertypes, box ? JavaType::ofBoxed : JavaType::of));
104    this.box = box;
105  }
106
107
108  /*
109   * Instance methods.
110   */
111
112
113  /**
114   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
115   * represents a Java type that has a name.
116   *
117   * <p>In the Java reflective type system, only {@link Class} and
118   * {@link TypeVariable} instances have names.</p>
119   *
120   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType} represents
121   * a Java type that has a name
122   *
123   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
124   * idempotent and deterministic.
125   *
126   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
127   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
128   *
129   * @see #name()
130   *
131   * @see Class#getName()
132   *
133   * @see TypeVariable#getName()
134   */
135  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
136  public final boolean named() {
137    final Type type = this.object();
138    return type instanceof Class || type instanceof TypeVariable;
139  }
140
141  /**
142   * Returns the name of this {@link JavaType} if it has one
143   * <strong>or {@code null} if it does not</strong>.
144   *
145   * <p>Only classes and type variables in the Java reflective type
146   * system have names.</p>
147   *
148   * @return the name of this {@link JavaType}, or {@code null}
149   *
150   * @nullability This method and its overrides may, and often will,
151   * return {@code null}.
152   *
153   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent
154   * and deterministic.
155   *
156   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
157   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
158   */
159  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
160  public final String name() {
161    final Type type = this.object();
162    if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
163      return c.getName();
164    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
165      return tv.getName();
166    }
167    return null;
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the return value of {@link
172   * #object()} is identical to {@link Object Object.class}.
173   *
174   * @return {@code true} if and only if the return value of {@link
175   * #object()} is identical to {@link Object Object.class}
176   *
177   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
178   *
179   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
180   * threads.
181   */
182  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
183  public final boolean top() {
184    return this.object() == Object.class;
185  }
186
187  /**
188   * Returns a {@link JavaType}, <strong>usually new</strong>, whose
189   * {@linkplain #object() modeled type} is {@linkplain
190   * JavaTypes#equals(Type, Type) equal to} the supplied {@link Type}.
191   *
192   * @param type the new {@link Type}; must not be {@code null}
193   *
194   * @return a {@link JavaType}, usually new
195   *
196   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
197   *
198   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
199   * return {@code null}.
200   *
201   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
202   * idempotent and deterministic.
203   *
204   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
205   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
206   *
207   * @see #withBox(boolean)
208   *
209   * @see #of(Type, boolean)
210   */
211  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
212  public final JavaType withObject(final Type type) {
213    return of(type, this.box);
214  }
215
216  /**
217   * Returns a {@link JavaType}, <strong>usually new</strong>, whose
218   * boxing strategy is modeled by the supplied {@code boolean}.
219   *
220   * @param box the new boxing strategy
221   *
222   * @return a {@link JavaType}, usually new
223   *
224   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
225   * return {@code null}.
226   *
227   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
228   * idempotent and deterministic.
229   *
230   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
231   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
232   *
233   * @see #withObject(Type)
234   *
235   * @see #of(Type, boolean)
236   */
237  public final JavaType withBox(final boolean box) {
238    return of(this.object(), box);
239  }
240
241  /**
242   * Returns an {@linkplain
243   * Collections#unmodifiableList(List) unmodifiable and
244   * immutable <code>List</code>} of the computed <em>direct
245   * supertypes</em> of this {@link JavaType}, or an {@linkplain
246   * Collection#isEmpty() empty <code>List</code>} if there are
247   * no direct supertypes.
248   *
249   * <p>This implementation uses the {@link
250   * JavaTypes#directSupertypes(Type)} method.</p>
251   *
252   * @return an {@linkplain
253   * Collections#unmodifiableList(List) unmodifiable and
254   * immutable <code>List</code>} of the computed <em>direct
255   * supertypes</em> of this {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
256   *
257   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
258   * return {@code null}.
259   *
260   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
261   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
262   *
263   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
264   * idempotent and deterministic.
265   */
266  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
267  protected final List<? extends org.microbean.type.Type<Type>> computeDirectSupertypes() {
268    final Type type = this.object();
269    return type == null ? List.of() : map(JavaTypes.directSupertypes(type), this::withObject);
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * If this {@link JavaType} represents a {@link ParameterizedType}
274   * or a {@link GenericArrayType} returns a {@link JavaType}
275   * representing its {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getRawType() raw
276   * type} or {@linkplain GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType()
277   * generic component type}, or, if this {@link JavaType} does not
278   * represent a {@link ParameterizedType} or a {@link
279   * GenericArrayType}, returns {@code this}.
280   *
281   * @return a suitable {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}; often {@code
282   * this}
283   *
284   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
285   * return {@code null}.
286   *
287   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
288   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
289   *
290   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
291   * idempotent and deterministic.
292   */
293  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
294  public final JavaType type() {
295    final Type type = this.object();
296    if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
297      return this.withObject(p.getRawType());
298    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
299      return this.withObject(g.getGenericComponentType());
300    } else {
301      return this;
302    }
303  }
304
305  /**
306   * Returns the owner of this {@link JavaType}, or {@code null} if
307   * there is no such {@link Owner}.
308   *
309   * @return the owner of this {@link JavaType}, or {@code null}
310   *
311   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
312   *
313   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
314   * threads.
315   *
316   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
317   */
318  @Experimental
319  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
320  public final Owner<Type> owner() {
321    final Type type = this.object();
322    if (type == null) {
323      return null;
324    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
325      final Class<?> enclosingClass = c.getEnclosingClass();
326      return enclosingClass == null ? null : this.withObject(enclosingClass);
327    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
328      final Type ownerType = p.getOwnerType();
329      return ownerType == null ? null : this.withObject(ownerType);
330    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
331      final GenericDeclaration gd = tv.getGenericDeclaration();
332      if (gd instanceof Class<?> c) {
333        return this.withObject(c);
334      } else if (gd instanceof Executable e) {
335        return new JavaExecutable(e, this.box);
336      } else {
337        throw new AssertionError("gd: " + gd);
338      }
339    } else {
340      return null;
341    }
342  }
343
344  /**
345   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
346   * represents a generic {@link Class} by virtue of having
347   * {@linkplain Class#getTypeParameters() type parameters}.
348   *
349   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
350   * {@link #object()} is an instance of {@link Class} and, if so, if
351   * that {@link Class} {@linkplain Class#getTypeParameters() has any
352   * type parameters}.
353   *
354   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
355   * a generic class by virtue of having {@linkplain
356   * Class#getTypeParameters() type parameters}
357   *
358   * @see #object()
359   *
360   * @see #typeParameters()
361   */
362  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
363  public final boolean hasTypeParameters() {
364    return this.object() instanceof Class<?> c && c.getTypeParameters().length > 0;
365  }
366
367  /**
368   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
369   * a {@link ParameterizedType} by virtue of {@linkplain
370   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() having type
371   * arguments}.
372   *
373   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
374   * {@link #object()} is a {@link ParameterizedType}.</p>
375   *
376   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
377   * a parameterized type by virtue of having {@linkplain
378   * ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() type arguments}
379   *
380   * @see #object()
381   *
382   * @see #typeArguments()
383   */
384  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
385  public final boolean hasTypeArguments() {
386    return this.object() instanceof ParameterizedType;
387  }
388
389  /**
390   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
391   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s type
392   * arguments.
393   *
394   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
395   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link JavaType} models a
396   * {@link ParameterizedType}.</p>
397   *
398   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
399   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s
400   * {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() type
401   * arguments}; never {@code null}
402   *
403   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
404   * return {@code null}.
405   *
406   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
407   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
408   *
409   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
410   * idempotent and deterministic.
411   */
412  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
413  public final List<? extends JavaType> typeArguments() {
414    if (this.object() instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
415      return map(p.getActualTypeArguments(), this::withObject);
416    }
417    return List.of();
418  }
419
420  /**
421   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
422   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s type
423   * parameters.
424   *
425   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
426   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link JavaType} models a generic
427   * {@link Class}.</p>
428   *
429   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
430   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s
431   * {@linkplain Class#getTypeParameters() type parameters}; never
432   * {@code null}
433   *
434   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
435   * return {@code null}.
436   *
437   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
438   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
439   *
440   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
441   * idempotent and deterministic.
442   */
443  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
444  public final List<? extends JavaType> typeParameters() {
445    if (this.object() instanceof Class<?> c) {
446      return map(c.getTypeParameters(), this::withObject);
447    }
448    return List.of();
449  }
450
451  /**
452   * Returns the {@linkplain Class#getComponentType() component type}
453   * of this {@link JavaType}, if there is one, <strong>or {@code
454   * null} if there is not</strong>.
455   *
456   * <p>This method returns a non-{@code null} result only when this
457   * {@link JavaType} represents a {@link Type} that is either
458   * {@linkplain Class#isArray() an array} or a {@link
459   * GenericArrayType}.</p>
460   *
461   * @return the {@linkplain Class#getComponentType() component type}
462   * of this {@link JavaType}, if there is one, or {@code null} if
463   * there is not
464   *
465   * @nullability This method and its overrides may return null.
466   *
467   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
468   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
469   *
470   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
471   * idempotent and deterministic.
472   *
473   * @see Class#getComponentType()
474   *
475   * @see GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType()
476   */
477  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
478  public final JavaType componentType() {
479    Type type = this.object();
480    if (type == null) {
481      return null;
482    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
483      type = c.getComponentType();
484    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
485      type = g.getGenericComponentType();
486    } else {
487      return null;
488    }
489    return type == null ? null : this.withObject(type);
490  }
491
492  /**
493   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
494   * represents either a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
495   * WildcardType}.
496   *
497   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
498   * {@link #object()} is either a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
499   * WildcardType}.</p>
500   *
501   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
502   * represents either a {@link TypeVariable} or a {@link
503   * WildcardType}
504   *
505   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
506   * idempotent and deterministic.
507   *
508   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
509   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
510   *
511   * @see #upperBounds()
512   */
513  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
514  public final boolean upperBounded() {
515    final Type type = this.object();
516    return type instanceof WildcardType || type instanceof TypeVariable;
517  }
518
519  /**
520   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
521   * a {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
522   * with a lower bound}.
523   *
524   * <p>This implementation checks to see if the return value of
525   * {@link #object()} is a {@link WildcardType}, and, if so, if that
526   * {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
527   * has a lower bound}.</p>
528   *
529   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link JavaType}
530   * represents a {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain
531   * WildcardType#getLowerBounds() with a lower bound}
532   *
533   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
534   * idempotent and deterministic.
535   *
536   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
537   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
538   *
539   * @see #lowerBounds()
540   *
541   * @see WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
542   */
543  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
544  public final boolean lowerBounded() {
545    return this.object() instanceof WildcardType w && w.getLowerBounds().length > 0;
546  }
547
548  /**
549   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
550   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s lower
551   * bounds.
552   *
553   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
554   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a {@link
555   * WildcardType} {@linkplain WildcardType#getLowerBounds() with a
556   * lower bound}.</p>
557   *
558   * <p>The returned {@link List} will contain at most one
559   * element.</p>
560   *
561   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
562   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s lower
563   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
564   * empty}
565   *
566   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
567   * return {@code null}.
568   *
569   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
570   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
571   *
572   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
573   * idempotent and deterministic.
574   *
575   * @see WildcardType#getLowerBounds()
576   */
577  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
578  public final List<? extends JavaType> lowerBounds() {
579    if (this.object() instanceof WildcardType w) {
580      return map(w.getLowerBounds(), this::withObject);
581    }
582    return List.of();
583  }
584
585  /**
586   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
587   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s upper
588   * bounds.
589   *
590   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
591   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models either a {@link
592   * WildcardType} or a {@link TypeVariable}.
593   *
594   * <p>The returned {@link List} will contain at most one
595   * element.</p>
596   *
597   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
598   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link JavaType}'s lower
599   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
600   * empty}
601   *
602   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
603   * return {@code null}.
604   *
605   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
606   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
607   *
608   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
609   * idempotent and deterministic.
610   *
611   * @see TypeVariable#getBounds()
612   *
613   * @see WildcardType#getUpperBounds()
614   */
615  @Override // org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
616  public final List<? extends JavaType> upperBounds() {
617    final Type type = this.object();
618    if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
619      return map(w.getUpperBounds(), this::withObject);
620    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> t) {
621      return map(t.getBounds(), this::withObject);
622    }
623    return List.of();
624  }
625
626  @Override // Owner<Type>
627  public final boolean objectEquals(final Object other) {
628    return this.object() == other || other instanceof Type && JavaTypes.equals(this.object(), this.box ? JavaTypes.box((Type)other) : (Type)other);
629  }
630
631
632  /*
633   * Static methods.
634   */
635
636
637  private static final JavaType of(final Object o) {
638    return of(o, false);
639  }
640
641  private static final JavaType ofBoxed(final Object o) {
642    return of(o, true);
643  }
644
645  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
646  private static final JavaType of(final Object o, final boolean box) {
647    if (o instanceof Type type) {
648      return of(type, box);
649    } else if (o instanceof Token<?> token) {
650      return of(token, box);
651    } else if (o instanceof org.microbean.type.Type<?> type) {
652      return of((org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type>)type, box);
653    } else {
654      throw new IllegalArgumentException();
655    }
656  }
657
658  /**
659   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
660   *
661   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the type to model; must
662   * not be {@code null}
663   *
664   * @return a new {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
665   *
666   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
667   *
668   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
669   *
670   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
671   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
672   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
673   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
674   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
675   * invocations are equal.
676   *
677   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
678   * threads.
679   *
680   * @see #of(Token, boolean)
681   */
682  public static final JavaType of(final Token<?> type) {
683    return of(type, false);
684  }
685
686  /**
687   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
688   *
689   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the type to model; must
690   * not be {@code null}
691   *
692   * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
693   *
694   * @return a new {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
695   *
696   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
697   *
698   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
699   *
700   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
701   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
702   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
703   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
704   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
705   * invocations are equal.
706   *
707   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
708   * threads.
709   *
710   * @see #of(Type, boolean)
711   */
712  public static final JavaType of(final Token<?> type, final boolean box) {
713    return of(type.type(), box);
714  }
715
716  /**
717   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
718   *
719   * @param type the {@link Type} that will be modeled; must not be
720   * {@code null}
721   *
722   * @return a new {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
723   *
724   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
725   *
726   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
727   *
728   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
729   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
730   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
731   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
732   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
733   * invocations are equal.
734   *
735   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
736   * threads.
737   *
738   * @see #of(Type, boolean)
739   */
740  public static final JavaType of(final Type type) {
741    return of(type, false);
742  }
743
744  /**
745   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
746   *
747   * @param type the {@link Type} that will be modeled; must not be
748   * {@code null}
749   *
750   * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
751   *
752   * @return a {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
753   *
754   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
755   *
756   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
757   *
758   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
759   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
760   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
761   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
762   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
763   * invocations are equal.
764   *
765   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
766   * threads.
767   */
768  public static final JavaType of(final Type type, final boolean box) {
769    return new JavaType(type, box);
770  }
771
772  /**
773   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
774   *
775   * @param type the {@link org.microbean.type.Type} whose {@linkplain
776   * org.microbean.type.Type#object() represented <code>Type</code>}
777   * will be modeled; must not be {@code null}
778   *
779   * @return a {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
780   *
781   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
782   *
783   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
784   *
785   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
786   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
787   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
788   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
789   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
790   * invocations are equal.
791   *
792   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
793   * threads.
794   *
795   * @see #of(org.microbean.type.Type, boolean)
796   */
797  public static final JavaType of(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> type) {
798    return of(type, false);
799  }
800
801  /**
802   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
803   *
804   * @param type the {@link org.microbean.type.Type} whose {@linkplain
805   * org.microbean.type.Type#object() represented <code>Type</code>}
806   * will be modeled; must not be {@code null}
807   *
808   * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
809   *
810   * @return a {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
811   *
812   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
813   *
814   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
815   *
816   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
817   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
818   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
819   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
820   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
821   * invocations are equal.
822   *
823   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
824   * threads.
825   *
826   * @see #of(Type, boolean)
827   */
828  public static final JavaType of(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> type, final boolean box) {
829    if (type instanceof JavaType jt && box == jt.box) {
830      return jt;
831    }
832    return of(type.object(), box);
833  }
834
835  /**
836   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
837   *
838   * @param supertypes a {@link List} of custom supertypes; must not
839   * be {@code null}
840   *
841   * @return a {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
842   *
843   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supertypes} is {@code
844   * null}.
845   *
846   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if any supertype is neither a
847   * {@link Type} nor a {@link Token} nor a {@link JavaType}
848   *
849   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
850   *
851   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
852   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
853   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
854   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
855   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
856   * invocations are equal.
857   *
858   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
859   * threads.
860   *
861   * @see #ofExact(List, boolean)
862   */
863  public static final JavaType ofExact(final List<?> supertypes) {
864    return ofExact(supertypes, false);
865  }
866
867  /**
868   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
869   *
870   * @param supertypes a {@link List} of custom supertypes; must not
871   * be {@code null}
872   *
873   * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
874   *
875   * @return a {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
876   *
877   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supertypes} is {@code
878   * null}.
879   *
880   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if any supertype is neither a
881   * {@link Type} nor a {@link Token} nor a {@link JavaType}
882   *
883   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
884   *
885   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
886   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
887   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
888   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
889   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
890   * invocations are equal.
891   *
892   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
893   * threads.
894   *
895   * @see #of(org.microbean.type.Type, boolean)
896   */
897  public static final JavaType ofExact(final List<?> supertypes, final boolean box) {
898    return new JavaType(supertypes, box);
899  }
900
901  /**
902   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
903   *
904   * @param type the sole supertype the returned {@link JavaType} will
905   * represent; must not be {@code null}
906   *
907   * @return a {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
908   *
909   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code
910   * null}.
911   *
912   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
913   *
914   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
915   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
916   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
917   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
918   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
919   * invocations are equal.
920   *
921   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
922   * threads.
923   *
924   * @see #ofExact(Type, boolean)
925   */
926  public static final JavaType ofExact(final Type type) {
927    return ofExact(List.of(type), false);
928  }
929
930  /**
931   * Returns a {@link JavaType} suitable for the supplied arguments.
932   *
933   * @param type the sole supertype the returned {@link JavaType} will
934   * represent; must not be {@code null}
935   *
936   * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
937   *
938   * @return a {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
939   *
940   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code
941   * null}.
942   *
943   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
944   *
945   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in
946   * that it may return a new {@link JavaType} with each invocation).
947   * However, any {@link JavaType} returned from this method is
948   * guaranteed to {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal} any other {@link
949   * JavaType} returned from this method, provided the inputs to all
950   * invocations are equal.
951   *
952   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
953   * threads.
954   *
955   * @see #ofExact(List, boolean)
956   */
957  public static final JavaType ofExact(final Type type, final boolean box) {
958    return ofExact(List.of(type), box);
959  }
960
961  /**
962   * Returns a boxed version of the supplied {@link
963   * org.microbean.type.Type}, if appropriate.
964   *
965   * @param type the {@link org.microbean.type.Type}; must not be
966   * {@code null}
967   *
968   * @return a boxed version of the supplied {@link
969   * org.microbean.type.Type}, if appropriate
970   *
971   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
972   *
973   * @idempotency This method is deterministic, but not necessarily
974   * idempotent.
975   *
976   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
977   * threads.
978   *
979   * @see #of(org.microbean.type.Type, boolean)
980   *
981   * @see JavaTypes#box(Type)
982   */
983  public static final JavaType box(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> type) {
984    return of(type, true);
985  }
986
987  /**
988   * Returns a {@link JavaType} representing a boxed version of the
989   * supplied {@link Type}, if appropriate.
990   *
991   * @param type the {@link Type}; must not be {@code null}
992   *
993   * @return a {@link JavaType} representing a boxed version of the
994   * supplied {@link Type}, if appropriate
995   *
996   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
997   *
998   * @idempotency This method is deterministic, but not necessarily
999   * idempotent.
1000   *
1001   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1002   * threads.
1003   *
1004   * @see #of(Type, boolean)
1005   *
1006   * @see JavaTypes#box(Type)
1007   */
1008  public static final JavaType box(final Type type) {
1009    return of(type, true);
1010  }
1011
1012
1013  /*
1014   * Inner and nested classes.
1015   */
1016
1017
1018  /**
1019   * A holder of a {@link Type} that embodies <a
1020   * href="http://gafter.blogspot.com/2006/12/super-type-tokens.html"
1021   * target="_parent">Gafter's gadget</a>.
1022   *
1023   * <p>To use this class, create a new instance of an anonymous
1024   * subclass of it, and then call {@link #type() type()} on it.  For
1025   * example:</p>
1026   *
1027   * <blockquote><pre>
1028   * // type will be a {@link ParameterizedType} whose {@link ParameterizedType#getRawType() rawType} is {@link java.util.List List.class} and
1029   * // whose {@linkplain ParameterizedType#getActualTypeArguments() sole type argument} is {@link String String.class}
1030   * {@link Type} type = new {@link Token Token}&lt;{@link java.util.List List}&lt;{@link String}&gt;&gt;() {}.{@link #type() type()};</pre></blockquote>
1031   *
1032   * @param <T> the modeled type; often parameterized
1033   *
1034   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
1035   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
1036   *
1037   * @see #type()
1038   */
1039  public static abstract class Token<T> {
1040
1041
1042    /*
1043     * Instance fields.
1044     */
1045
1046
1047    private final Type type;
1048
1049
1050    /*
1051     * Constructors.
1052     */
1053
1054
1055    /**
1056     * Creates a new {@link Token}.
1057     */
1058    protected Token() {
1059      super();
1060      this.type = mostSpecializedParameterizedSuperclass(this.getClass()).getActualTypeArguments()[0];
1061    }
1062
1063
1064    /*
1065     * Instance methods.
1066     */
1067
1068
1069    /**
1070     * Returns the {@link Type} modeled by this {@link Token}.
1071     *
1072     * @return the {@link Type} modeled by this {@link Token}; never
1073     * {@code null}
1074     *
1075     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1076     *
1077     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1078     * threads.
1079     *
1080     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1081     */
1082    public final Type type() {
1083      return this.type;
1084    }
1085
1086    /**
1087     * Returns the {@linkplain JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of
1088     * this {@link Token}'s {@linkplain #type() modeled
1089     * <code>Type</code>}, or {@code null} if erasing the {@link Type}
1090     * would result in a non-{@link Class} erasure (in which case the
1091     * erasure is simply the {@link Type} itself), or if an erasure
1092     * cannot be determined.
1093     *
1094     * @return the {@linkplain JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of
1095     * this {@link Token}'s {@linkplain #type() modeled
1096     * <code>Type</code>}, or {@code null} if erasing the {@link Type}
1097     * would result in a non-{@link Class} erasure, or if an erasure
1098     * cannot be determined
1099     *
1100     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1101     *
1102     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1103     * threads.
1104     *
1105     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1106     */
1107    public final Class<?> erase() {
1108      return JavaTypes.erase(this.type());
1109    }
1110
1111    /**
1112     * Returns a hashcode for this {@link Token} computed from the
1113     * {@link Type} it {@linkplain #type() models}.
1114     *
1115     * @return a hashcode for this {@link Token}
1116     *
1117     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
1118     * concurrent use by multiple threads.
1119     *
1120     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1121     * idempotent and deterministic.
1122     *
1123     * @see #equals(Object)
1124     */
1125    @Override // Object
1126    public int hashCode() {
1127      final Type type = this.type();
1128      return type == null ? 0 : type.hashCode();
1129    }
1130
1131    /**
1132     * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to
1133     * this {@link Token}.
1134     *
1135     * <p>This method returns {@code true} if the supplied {@link
1136     * Object}'s {@linkplain Object#getClass() class} is this {@link
1137     * Token}'s class and if its {@linkplain #type() modeled
1138     * <code>Type</code>} is equal to this {@link Token}'s
1139     * {@linkplain #type() modeled <code>Type</code>}.</p>
1140     *
1141     * @param other the {@link Object} to test; may be {@code null} in
1142     * which case {@code false} will be returned
1143     *
1144     * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to
1145     * this {@link Token}; {@code false} otherwise
1146     *
1147     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
1148     * concurrent use by multiple threads.
1149     *
1150     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1151     * idempotent and deterministic.
1152     *
1153     * @see #hashCode()
1154     */
1155    @Override // Object
1156    public boolean equals(final Object other) {
1157      if (other == this) {
1158        return true;
1159      } else if (other instanceof Token<?> tt) {
1160        return Objects.equals(this.type(), tt.type());
1161      } else {
1162        return false;
1163      }
1164    }
1165
1166    /**
1167     * Returns a {@link String} representation of this {@link
1168     * Token}.
1169     *
1170     * <p>This method returns a value equal to that returned by {@link
1171     * Type#getTypeName() this.type().getTypeName()}.</p>
1172     *
1173     * @return a {@link String} representation of this {@link
1174     * Token}; never {@code null}
1175     *
1176     * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
1177     * return {@code null}.
1178     *
1179     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
1180     * concurrent use by multiple threads.
1181     *
1182     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1183     * idempotent and deterministic.
1184     */
1185    @Override // Object
1186    public String toString() {
1187      final Type type = this.type();
1188      return type == null ? "null" : type.getTypeName();
1189    }
1190
1191
1192    /*
1193     * Static methods.
1194     */
1195
1196
1197    private static final ParameterizedType mostSpecializedParameterizedSuperclass(final Type type) {
1198      if (type == null || type == Object.class || type == Token.class) {
1199        return null;
1200      } else {
1201        final Class<?> erasure = JavaTypes.erase(type);
1202        if (erasure == null || erasure == Object.class || !(Token.class.isAssignableFrom(erasure))) {
1203          return null;
1204        } else {
1205          return type instanceof ParameterizedType p ? p : mostSpecializedParameterizedSuperclass(erasure.getGenericSuperclass());
1206        }
1207      }
1208    }
1209
1210  }
1211
1212}
